message: @Tony, are the test cases you have in the test plan final or you plan to have changes in it?
It is for the traceability purposes
We're still talking about them..
ok cool

So for me so far i have done a little research in tracaebility, and since it is showing the relation between requirements, use cases and test cases, i am creating a matrix that shows two different relation
1st requirements to use case and then use case to test case, still work in progress though :)

I'm about to head back to my house from work, but just a quick update from my end:
I worked on a MySQL database schema to hold the data last night and was going to work a bit on creating a web service to interact with the database that the Android App could easily take advantage via Android's built-in HttpClient and JSON handling capabilities. Once the web service piece is put together we should be able to write some code like that displayed in this article:
http://codeoncloud.blogspot.com/2013/07/android-mysql-php-json-tutorial.html
to interact with the service and create/read/update/delete data

If we can get this implemented it'll be a pretty neat capability that should hopefully earn us some extra points ;-)
be back on in a few :-)

just saying that if so, then refills are half price no matter what, we just count refills on the coffee.

I think the main thing there is unlimited free refills, versus unlimited half price refills between the two (I don't think the coffee cart owner would say no to additional business from one customer who isn't at the gold level)
just asking.

@MuraliRaju Mainly I think it was that there wasn't a clear spot for you to see exactly what was in the cart at a glance (most of the important information was popping up in the notifications that appeared at the bottom of the screen but then they'd go away). I liked the Activity Bar at the bottom though. I was thinking the initial screen for the employee would look something like what we see in PayPal here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.paypal.here&hl=en (so they can select a customer, add items, see the total, confirm the purchase / clear the cart, etc. on that main screen)

@ChandraSapkota what did the traceability term actually mean?
Its like showing which requirements is related to what use-cases and what test cases are associated with the use-case and the requirements
It's like creating a matrix showing one related to the other, so we can trace forward and backwards
ok, so we're ok on that one?
